page.title: 09Education
page.content: Temple Guiting School was opened in 1873 following the Forster's Education Act of 1870. It is now 112 years old. It is built of Cotswold stone and has had a new roof recently. In 1947 a kitchen extension was built and meals are still cooked on the premises. In the 1950's the old earth closet toilets were modernised and in the 1960's the old coke stoves were removed and replaced by electricity night store heaters. The windows are very high so that the children are not distracted by thing s outside. The first headteacher was Miss Mary Drury, followed by Edward Phillips. Mr. Iain Rushin, the present headteacher is the 16th since the school began. There are 36 children in school at the moment and they learn Language,Maths,Science,Art and Craft, History,Games,Music etc.
